tenses.definition: The Present Indefinite tense is used to describe actions that are regular, habitual, or universal truths. It talks about things that happen regularly or facts that are always true.

structure.affirmative: Subject + base verb (add 's' or 'es' for 3rd person singular)

word_by_word.does: Auxiliary verb (helping verb for 3rd person singular)

word_by_word.Do: Auxiliary verb (used to ask a question)

example_urdu.affirmative: میں ہر روز فٹ بال کھیلتا ہوں۔
example_urdu.interrogative: کیا آپ ویک اینڈ پر کام کرتے ہیں؟

tenses.definition: The Present Continuous tense is used to describe actions that are happening at the moment of speaking or around the present time. It is also used for temporary actions or situations.

structure.negative: Subject + am/are/is + not + base verb + ing

interrogative.sentence: Is she studying for the exam?

word_by_word.Is: Auxiliary verb (used to ask a question)

example_urdu.negative: وہ فٹ بال نہیں کھیل رہے ہیں۔
example_urdu.interrogative: کیا وہ امتحان کے لیے پڑھ رہی ہے؟

tenses.definition: The Present Perfect tense is used to describe actions that were completed at some point in the past but are relevant to or have an impact on the present. It can also express experiences.

word_by_word.Have: Auxiliary verb (used to ask a question)

example_urdu.affirmative: میں نے اپنا ہوم ورک مکمل کر لیا ہے۔
example_urdu.interrogative: کیا انہوں نے فلم دیکھی ہے؟

tenses.definition: The Present Perfect Continuous tense is used to describe actions that began in the past and are still continuing in the present. It emphasizes the duration of an action.

structure.affirmative: Subject + have/has + been + base verb + ing
structure.negative: Subject + have/has + not + been + base verb + ing
structure.interrogative: Have/Has + subject + been + base verb + ing?

affirmative.sentence: They have been working on this project for hours.

word_by_word.have been: Auxiliary verbs (show continuity in the present perfect tense)
word_by_word.working: Base verb + ing (action happening over time)
word_by_word.for hours: Duration (how long the action has been happening)

negative.sentence: She has not been studying since morning.

word_by_word.has not been: Auxiliary verbs + negation (makes the sentence negative)
word_by_word.studying: Base verb + ing (action happening over time)

interrogative.sentence: Have they been waiting for the bus?

word_by_word.Have: Auxiliary verb (used to ask a question)
word_by_word.waiting: Base verb + ing (action happening over time)

example_urdu.affirmative: وہ کئی گھنٹوں سے اس پروجیکٹ پر کام کر رہے ہیں۔
example_urdu.negative: وہ صبح سے نہیں پڑھ رہی ہے۔
example_urdu.interrogative: کیا وہ بس کا انتظار کر رہے ہیں؟

tenses.definition: The Past Indefinite tense is used to describe actions that were completed in the past. It indicates a specific point in time.

affirmative.sentence: He went to the market yesterday.

word_by_word.went: Past simple verb (action completed in the past)

negative.sentence: They did not finish the work on time.

word_by_word.did not: Auxiliary verb + negation (makes the sentence negative)
word_by_word.on time: Time (when it should have been completed)

interrogative.sentence: Did you see the movie last night?

word_by_word.Did: Auxiliary verb (used to ask a question)
word_by_word.see: Base verb (action done in the past)

example_urdu.negative: انہوں نے وقت پر کام مکمل نہیں کیا۔
example_urdu.interrogative: کیا آپ نے کل رات فلم دیکھی؟

tenses.definition: The Past Continuous tense is used to describe actions that were ongoing at a specific point in the past. It indicates an action in progress.

structure.negative: Subject + was/were + not + base verb + ing

affirmative.sentence: She was reading a novel at 8 PM.

word_by_word.reading: Base verb + ing (action happening in the past)

negative.sentence: They were not playing in the park.

word_by_word.were not: Auxiliary verb + negation (makes the sentence negative)

interrogative.sentence: Was he watching TV when you called?

word_by_word.Was: Auxiliary verb (used to ask a question)
word_by_word.watching: Base verb + ing (action happening in the past)

example_urdu.affirmative: وہ رات آٹھ بجے ناول پڑھ رہی تھی۔
example_urdu.negative: وہ پارک میں کھیل نہیں رہے تھے۔
example_urdu.interrogative: کیا وہ ٹی وی دیکھ رہا تھا جب آپ نے فون کیا؟

tenses.definition: The Past Perfect tense is used to describe an action that was completed before another action in the past.

affirmative.sentence: She had finished her homework before the teacher arrived.

negative.sentence: They had not eaten breakfast by 9 AM.

word_by_word.had not: Auxiliary verb + negation (makes the sentence negative)
word_by_word.by 9 AM: Time (when it should have been completed)

interrogative.sentence: Had you ever visited that museum before?

word_by_word.Had: Auxiliary verb (used to ask a question)

example_urdu.affirmative: وہ اپنے استاد کے آنے سے پہلے اپنا ہوم ورک مکمل کر چکی تھی۔
example_urdu.negative: انہوں نے صبح 9 بجے تک ناشتہ نہیں کیا تھا۔
example_urdu.interrogative: کیا آپ نے کبھی اس میوزیم کا دورہ کیا تھا؟

tenses.definition: The Past Perfect Continuous tense is used to describe actions that were ongoing for a duration of time before another action in the past.

structure.affirmative: Subject + had + been + base verb + ing
structure.negative: Subject + had + not + been + base verb + ing
structure.interrogative: Had + subject + been + base verb + ing?

affirmative.sentence: I had been waiting for the bus for 30 minutes before it arrived.

negative.sentence: They had not been working on the project for a long time.

word_by_word.had not been: Auxiliary verbs + negation (makes the sentence negative)

interrogative.sentence: Had she been studying for hours before the exam?

word_by_word.Had: Auxiliary verb (used to ask a question)

example_urdu.affirmative: میں بس کے آنے سے پہلے 30 منٹ سے انتظار کر رہا تھا۔
example_urdu.negative: انہوں نے بہت زیادہ وقت تک پروجیکٹ پر کام نہیں کیا تھا۔
example_urdu.interrogative: کیا وہ امتحان سے پہلے کئی گھنٹوں سے پڑھ رہی تھی؟

tenses.definition: The Future Indefinite tense is used to describe actions that will happen in the future. It indicates decisions or plans made at the moment of speaking.

negative.sentence: She will not attend the meeting.

word_by_word.will not: Auxiliary verb + negation (makes the sentence negative)

interrogative.sentence: Will they complete the task by next week?

word_by_word.Will: Auxiliary verb (used to ask a question)

example_urdu.affirmative: میں آپ کو کل فون کروں گا۔
example_urdu.negative: وہ میٹنگ میں شرکت نہیں کرے گی۔
example_urdu.interrogative: کیا وہ اگلے ہفتے تک کام مکمل کر لیں گے؟

tenses.definition: The Future Continuous tense is used to describe actions that will be happening at a particular moment in the future. It emphasizes the ongoing nature of an event or action.

structure.affirmative: Subject + will + be + base verb + ing
structure.negative: Subject + will + not + be + base verb + ing
structure.interrogative: Will + subject + be + base verb + ing?

affirmative.sentence: I will be reading a book at 8 PM.

negative.sentence: She will not be attending the party tomorrow.

word_by_word.will not: Auxiliary verb + negation (makes the sentence negative)
word_by_word.attending: Base verb + ing (action happening in the future)
word_by_word.the party: Object (what she will not be attending)

interrogative.sentence: Will they be traveling next week?

word_by_word.Will: Auxiliary verb (used to ask a question)
word_by_word.traveling: Base verb + ing (action happening in the future)

example_urdu.affirmative: میں 8 بجے کتاب پڑھ رہا ہوں گا۔
example_urdu.negative: وہ کل پارٹی میں شرکت نہیں کرے گی۔
example_urdu.interrogative: کیا وہ اگلے ہفتے سفر کر رہے ہوں گے؟

tenses.definition: The Future Perfect tense is used to describe an action that will be completed before a specific time or event in the future.

structure.negative: Subject + will + not + have + past participle

affirmative.sentence: By 2025, I will have completed my degree.

word_by_word.By 2025: Time (when the action will be completed)

negative.sentence: They will not have finished the work by Friday.

word_by_word.will not: Auxiliary verb + negation (makes the sentence negative)
word_by_word.by Friday: Time (when the action will be completed)

interrogative.sentence: Will you have finished your homework by tomorrow?

word_by_word.Will: Auxiliary verb (used to ask a question)
word_by_word.by tomorrow: Time (when the action will be completed)

example_urdu.affirmative: 2025 تک میں اپنی ڈگری مکمل کر لوں گا۔
example_urdu.negative: وہ جمعہ تک کام مکمل نہیں کر پائیں گے۔
example_urdu.interrogative: کیا آپ کل تک اپنا ہوم ورک مکمل کر لیں گے؟

tenses.definition: The Future Perfect Continuous tense is used to describe actions that will have been happening for a duration of time up until a specific point in the future.

structure.affirmative: Subject + will + have + been + base verb + ing
structure.negative: Subject + will + not + have + been + base verb + ing
structure.interrogative: Will + subject + have + been + base verb + ing?

affirmative.sentence: By next year, I will have been working here for five years.

word_by_word.By next year: Time (when the action will be completed)
word_by_word.for five years: Duration (how long the action will last)

negative.sentence: They will not have been living in this city for long.

word_by_word.will not: Auxiliary verb + negation (makes the sentence negative)
word_by_word.for long: Duration (how long the action will last)

interrogative.sentence: Will you have been working on this project for a year by next month?

word_by_word.Will: Auxiliary verb (used to ask a question)
word_by_word.on this project: Object (what you will be working on)
word_by_word.for a year: Duration (how long the action will last)
word_by_word.by next month: Time (when the action will be completed)

example_urdu.affirmative: اگلے سال تک میں یہاں پانچ سال سے کام کر رہا ہوں گا۔
example_urdu.negative: وہ اس شہر میں زیادہ وقت تک نہیں رہیں گے۔
example_urdu.interrogative: کیا آپ اگلے ماہ تک اس پروجیکٹ پر ایک سال سے کام کر رہے ہوں گے؟
